page.title: 12HOUSING IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content: The majority of the houses date from the present century and are built of brick with tiled roofs. Clustered around the Green at Stow Longa are several sixteenth century cottages, with timber frames and thatched roofs, while Stow Cottage, on the outskirts of the village, is another attractive house from the same period. Most houses are privately owned, but Stow Longa has two groups of council houses, some now owned by their former tenants. Some of the farm cottages in the area are still occupied by agricultural workers, while others are rented by private tenants, including servicemen from U.S.A.F.Alconbury. Property in Stow Longa is expensive by Cambridgeshire standards, and young married couples can seldom afford to buy houses in the village.
